intro: Atriplex rosea var. ruppiana, commonly known as saltbush, is a perennial shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its succulent, lobed leaves that are adapted to retain moisture in dry environments. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, terminal inflorescences. It is often found in saline soils and is valued for its ability to stabilize soil and provide forage for wildlife. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological restoration projects.
